NOTES: Ex-Seleka and Peul ambushed an Anti-Balaka vehicle. At least ten combatants died in the ensuing clash, including four Anti-Balaka and six ex-Seleka and Peul. French journalist Camille Lepage, who was on assignment with the Anti-Balaka, was also killed.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Okapi National Park
NOTES: Mayi Mayi Simba attacked a group of US journalists in Okapi National Park. The park guards accompanying the journalists fought back. 4 park guards were killed and 1 US journalist was kidnapped. He was released the following day.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) National Intelligence Agency
ACTOR2: Private Security Forces (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: 02 January. Six armed men claiming to be members of the Democratic Republic of Congo's National Intelligence Agency (ANR) attempted to enter the home of journalist Tshivis Tshivuadi in Kinshasa. The assailants severely assaulted a guard at the residence.
Islamic State mortar and sniper fire wounded four in West Mosul, including an Agence France Presse journalist.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
SOURCE: El Siglo de Durango; La Silla Rota
NOTES: On 2 August 2020, in Iguala de la Independencia, Guerrero, a journalist from the PM news website was shot dead along with a state police officer inside a restaurant. The journalist had previously suffered another armed attack in 2016 and was under the Protection of Human Rights Defenders and Journalists mechanism of the Federal Secretariat. 2 fatalities.

On 25 Feb 2020, a journalist and PML-N local leader was shot dead by unidentified assailants at Shakardara area (Swat district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa). A police guard of the journalist who was with him at the time of the incident remained unhurt.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Government of the Philippines (2016-); Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Barangay Peacekeeping Action Team; Private Security Forces (Philippines); Journalists (Philippines)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Criminal Investigation and Detection Group
SOURCE: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Rappler; Philippine Star; CNN
NOTES: On 30 July 2017, a drug suspect-cum-mayor and 15 others (including his family, 3 BPAT members, 2 Lumad TV staff) were killed in a shootout between private bodyguards and police forces (PNP and PNP-CIDG) in Barangays Baybay San Roque (at least 7 dead) and Santa Cruz (at least 6 dead) in Ozamiz city (Misamis Occidental, Northern Mindanao). Three others, including a police officer, were injured. 5 associates, including the vice mayor, were arrested (1 of 2 events).

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
NOTES: Houthi fighters stormed Saleh-ownedAl-Yemen Alyoum satellite TV station (located in Bayt al Baws) in southern Sanaa and took it over following deadly clashes late on Saturday. Three guards were wounded by an RPG that was fired at the building. 41 people are being held hostage by the militia members. Al-Jazeera Arabic announced that most of the Journalists were all released on the 14th of December, 2017. An official from the internationally recognized Hadi government confirmed that the other four hostages died after sustaining injuries from the al Houthi takeover of the station.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
NOTES: In the southern city of Taiz, residents told Gulf News that a local right activist was killed in Al Houthi mortar and gunfire attacks as government forces engage in fierce clashes with rebels on the city's outskirts. Al Houthi snipers gunned down Raham Al Bader, an activist, and her associate who were documenting Al Houthi attacks on civilians on the eastern outskirts of the city. As many as 12 Houthis were killed in the ensuing firefight. Fatalities are counted as 12 Houthis and 2 activists.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
SOURCE: Yemen News Agency SABA; Yemen Data Project
NOTES: In Jawf, pro-Houthi forces claim to have killed and wounded a 'dozens' of pro-Hadi troops in the Hazmah area of Matun district. Fatalities (12) coded as half (6). An Al-Masirah cameraman was reported injured by a stray bullet or shell during the firefight. 7 airstrikes were launched during the battles.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
SOURCE: Yemen Data Project; Barakish; Yemen News Agency (SABA) - Pro-Houthi
NOTES: Pro-Houthi forces claimed to have taken control of two sites in the Qaniyah front bordering Al Bayda and Marib governorates, following clashes with pro-Hadi forces and affiliates during which a number of the latter were killed. Unknown reported fatalities coded as 10. Journalist Ahmad al Hamzi, director of SABA News in Al Bayda governorate, was reported killed by pro-Houthi shelling in the Qaniyah front bordering Al Bayda and Marib govenrorates.
